meanings.definition: To eradicate or remove completely, especially from a particular place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The gardener had to outroot the stubborn weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent2: It is important to outroot any negative thoughts from your mind.
meanings.sent3: The superhero used their powers to outroot the evil villain from the city.
meanings.sent4: She managed to outroot the fear that had been holding her back for so long.
meanings.sent5: The detective worked tirelessly to outroot the corruption in the city.

meanings.definition: To pull up by the roots; uproot.
meanings.sent1: The storm was so strong that it managed to outroot the old tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to outroot the carrots to harvest them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to outroot all the newly planted flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The decision to move outrooted her from her comfort zone.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake had the power to outroot entire trees from the ground.

meanings.definition: To destroy the root or foundation of; extirpate.
meanings.sent1: The invasive species threatened to outroot the native plants in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The dictator aimed to outroot any opposition to his rule.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell accidentally outrooted the entire garden.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal outrooted the trust she had in her friend.
meanings.sent5: The virus spread rapidly, threatening to outroot the entire network system.
